intro: Wahlenbergia fernandeziana f. elata, commonly known as the Falkland Islands bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Falkland Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has a compact, mat-forming habit. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it is adapted to the cool, maritime climate of its native habitat. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
